name: webrat
description: Webrat - Ruby Acceptance Testing for Web applications
readme:
Webrat
======

- [Code on GitHub](http://github.com/brynary/webrat)
- [Tickets on Lighthouse](http://webrat.lighthouseapp.com/)

Description
-----------

Webrat (_Ruby Acceptance Testing for Web applications_)
lets you quickly write robust and thorough acceptance tests for a Ruby
web application. By leveraging the DOM, it can run tests similarly to an
in-browser testing solution without the associated performance hit (and
browser dependency). The result is tests that are less fragile and more
effective at verifying that the app will respond properly to users.

When comparing Webrat with an in-browser testing solution like Watir or
Selenium, the primary consideration should be how much JavaScript the
application uses. In-browser testing is currently the only way to test JS, and
that may make it a requirement for your project. If JavaScript is not central
to your application, Webrat is a simpler, effective solution that will let you
run your tests much faster and more frequently.

Initial development was sponsored by [EastMedia](http://www.eastmedia.com).

Synopsis
--------

    def test_sign_up
      visits "/"
      clicks_link "Sign up"
      fills_in "Email", :with => "good@example.com"
      selects "Free account"
      clicks_button "Register"
      ...
    end
  
Behind the scenes, this will perform the following work:

1. Verify that loading the home page is successful
2. Verify that a "Sign up" link exists on the home page
3. Verify that loading the URL pointed to by the "Sign up" link leads to a
   successful page
4. Verify that there is an "Email" input field on the Sign Up page
5. Verify that there is an select field on the Sign Up page with an option for
   "Free account"
6. Verify that there is a "Register" submit button on the page
7. Verify that submitting the Sign Up form with the values "good@example.com"
   and "Free account" leads to a successful page

Take special note of the things _not_ specified in that test, that might cause
tests to break unnecessarily as your application evolves:

- The input field IDs or names (e.g. "user_email" or "user[email]"), which
  could change if you rename a model
- The ID of the form element (Webrat can do a good job of guessing, even if
  there are multiple forms on the page.)
- The URLs of links followed
- The URL the form submission should be sent to, which could change if you
  adjust your routes or controllers
- The HTTP method for the login request

A test written with Webrat can handle these changes to these without any modifications.

Install
-------

To install the latest release:

    sudo gem install webrat

In your stories/helper.rb:
  
    require "webrat"
  
You could also unpack the gem into vendor/plugins.

Requirements
------------

- Rails >= 1.2.6
- Hpricot >= 0.6
- Rails integration tests in Test::Unit _or_
- RSpec stories (using an RSpec version >= revision 2997)

Authors
-------

- Maintained by [Bryan Helmkamp](mailto:bryan@brynary.com)
- Original code written by [Seth Fitzsimmons](mailto:seth@mojodna.net)
- Many other contributors. See attributions in History.txt

License
-------

Copyright (c) 2007 Bryan Helmkamp, Seth Fitzsimmons.
See MIT-LICENSE.txt in this directory.

commit.message: Make the fills_in method also work for hidden fields.
Add preliminary specs for RailsSession (Mike Schwab/BH)
Fix bug in support for HTTPS with Rails LM/BH
Added support for HTTP_REFERER header, so that redirect_to :back works
Add some missing spec coverage. Bump coverage theshold
Expose current DOM (as an Hpricot object) as current_dom. Fix SSL support
Add backwards compatability for current_page. Fix some bugs with Rails integration
Removing Page class (functionality is now in Session and Scope)
Remove usage of method_missing in favor of explicit delegators
Delegate from Session to Scope instead of Page
More specs for within. Move save_and_open functionality to session.
Refactor clicks_link_within to use new within functionality
Add #within method for working within a selector scope
Support &nbsp's as spaces in matching link text (Patch from Luke Melia)
Switch from Mocha to RSpec mocks
Add spec for finding inputs by alt text
Alias visits as visit, clicks_link as click_link, etc.
Merge branch 'master' of git://github.com/ismasan/webrat into ismasan/master
Merge branch 'master' of git://github.com/timcharper/webrat into timcharper/master
Don't open blank pages in the browser (Path from Kyle Hargraves)
radio buttons can have multiple labels
Add support for disabling JavaScript when clicking a link to enable testing of both JS and non-JS implementations LM/BH

Added options to selenium session methods to better handle ajax operations. For example: clicks_link('Foo', :wait => :ajax). I'd love to figure out
how to infer whether a click results in ajax vs. dom manipulation vs. page load, but we'll start with this.
Spiked a Selenium session type for webrat.
Support specification of content type in attaches_file()
Sorting libraries before require to avoid load order issues on server
Added method for matching alt attributes in fields (primarly for clicks_button)
added spec to test webrat's ability to recognize image buttons
Remove references to RAILS_ROOT from Webrat core

Merge branch 'master' of git@github.com:brynary/webrat

Conflicts:

	Rakefile
	lib/webrat/core/page.rb
Start isolating Rails-specific webrat components to prepare for additional modes (Merb and WWW::Mechanize)
save_and_open_page rewrites css and image references to provide a friendlier debugging experience
Added prelimary support for fully qualified links starting with http:// or https://. Restored missing commits(???)
WTF. Hoe requires README to be named README.txt.  Sorry markdown, will try another night.
Renamed README to get Markdown highlighting in github

Add attaches_file method

Note that file submissions in integration tests are only supported
on edge rails after revision 8978. Rick DeNatale has backported
support to 2.0.2; see his blog entry at:

http://talklikeaduck.denhaven2.com/articles/2008/04/18/rails-integration-test-file-upload-plugin
Setup rake to run specs by default and verify RCov coverage
Renamed README.markdown back to README.txt to make hoe happy. ::sigh::

Pretty specdoc strings

Thank you, vim.
Convert README to Markdown syntax. Copy edits
Add spec suite to replace test suite

Add support for 'button' elements in forms, and selecting
them by inner text
Fix bug with empty select list
Fix bug that causes explosions when there is a file field on the page
Merge branch 'select-by-regexp' of git://github.com/pd/webrat into pd/select-by-regexp
Merge branch 'relative-links' of git://github.com/pd/webrat into pd/relative-links
Ability to select options by regexp
Restore behavior where we don't require select names (for now)
Fix some bugs uncovered when running the weplay scenarios
Combined field files. Dynamically figure out field classes
Bump version for eventual next release
Fix regression of not sending default values in password fields
Split History file by change type
Add URLs. Fix description and URL for hoe
Bump revision in preparation for release

Really fix merging of input collection

* Don't union the arrays
* Don't sort the arrays (in particular, HashWithIndifferentAccess has no <=>)
* Merge deeply nested collections
Fix incorrect serializing of collection inputs, i.e. name contains []
Added reloads method to reload the page (note: it may resubmit forms)
Prevent making a request if clicking on local anchor link
Serialize empty text field values just like browsers
Merge branch 'master' of git://github.com/lukemelia/webrat into lukemelia/master
Added clicks_link_within(selector, link_text), allowing restricting link search to within a given css selector.
Changed clicks_link to find the shortest matching link.
Added default form values for select menus.
Add save_and_open_page. Add radio button support via #chooses method
Use Hoe's developer syntax in Rakefile
Fix bad reference to #select method in README (Patch from Luke Melia)

comments.body:
Hey Chris,

Thanks for the patch. I'm thinking allowing fill_in to target hidden fields probably violates the principle of least surprise though. Would it make sense and work for you if it was handled in a separate method? Maybe #set_hidden_field ?

WDYT?

Cheers,

-Bryan
Another method is quite fine by me - basically just some means to set a hidden field is all I need.  Thanks.

name: business--isbn
description: Perl module to deal with International Standard Book Numbers

commit.message:
Require an existing Tie::Cycle

Several testers somehow picked up a non-existent
Tie::Cycle that caused the tests to fail.
Move module into the right place
Move modules to conventional location, modernize Makefile.PL

Downgrade to ExtUtils::MakeMaker 6.64

And add CONFIGURE_REQUIRES for it. I want this
for TEST_REQUIRES.
Look in the current directory for RangeMessage
Don't show line number in message since it's a private function
Credit Markus Spann for the idea to look in the current directory

Add data source date to the data structure

It's the same as the version number of the module.
Get rid of Test::ISBN circular dependency
Credit Markus Spann for increment and decrement
Add the first steps for testing increments

Add stuff to increment and decrement articles

And support functions for that

Update bad isbns to use a bad group code

The latest ranges include the bad ones that I 
used earlier.
quote the numbers in the ranges
Update the data with the latest

Update the program that formats the data.

The old format disappeared, but that's no problem
because I can use the parser I've already added to
the module.

Merge pull request #4 from dsteinbrunner/patch-1

Added cpan repository metadata
Update MANIFEST, add test for Github issue #3
Github #3: Don't set GOOD_ISBN at the end of _check_validity.
Changes to fix test for Haiti group code
Fix Changes version sequence in Data
99970 is now a valid group code (for Haiti)
Specify version of Test::More, and other modules, even if they're core
Get rid of stupid Mac files during clean
Add RangeMessage.xml from the ISBN agency
Update Data.pm for latest ISBN ranges
Remove the * for the non-list of bugs

Merge branch 'cvstags' into xisbn

Conflicts:
	ISBN/t/xisbn.t
Move lib files to conventional location
Update xisbn test for right URL
* don't use defined with a hash. That's deprecated
* Guard against invalid ISBN formats in valid_isbn_checksum. Remove SVN keywords

* Update the copyright date on everything

* Update the SOURCE reference to Github

* Update prereqs, copyright date

* Update latest version of Business::ISBN::Data, which changed "English"
to "English Speaking Area", causing test failures for older versions.

* Updated for latest data

* The make_data.pl file now looks at the javascript version of
the range data, although even that appears to be hand-edited.

* Updated version to 2.05, now that I know 2.04_01 works. That
change makes the PNG tests optional.

* Check group text with a regex. The ISBN data has "English
speaking area" instead of just "English", for instance.
* Need to make this a developer release"

* Remove the GD prereq. Everyone seems to be having a problem
with borked GD installs.

* Require 5.8 from here on out.

* Require the latest versions of Test::Manifest and Business::ISBN::Data

* Also require GD::Barcode::EAN13.

* The ISBN Agency added a prefix for Gabon (99902), so my test
data for a bad prefix is now failing. I'll use 99970 instead.

Cleanup up formatting of Changes, and remove the entry for
the aborted release

* Use the date as the version number, and document that

* Update the repository, copyright, and credits.
* Let's do versions based on the date
* get rid of .cvsignore since we're not using CVS
* Let MakeMaker add the META.yml, and release takes care of Test::Prereq
* New publisher ranges from Yakov Shafranovich
* added dropbox directory to hold various docs I find
* make png_barcode test work, skip everything if no GD::Barcode::EAN13
* distro cleanups - add ABSTRACT to Makefile.PL
* Disable Test::Pod::Coverage because Pod::Coverage is broken
* Workaround odd bug about modifying non-lvalue subroutine.

* update version and MANIFEST for new test file
* This is another dev release before pushing 2.03 out the door
* test for RT 29292: ensure ISBN 13 has hypens in the right place

* ISBN13::group should return the same group ISBN10 would. I had a
method in there for testing and it always returned "Bookland".
That's the wrong behavior though.
* add ISBN13 test files to manifest

* RT #29089 - _max_length in ISBN13.pm still says 10. Now fixed.

Along the way, I've added some ISBN13 test data.

I've also updated the *::Data prereq to the latest version.
* RT #29078: Fix formatting error in publisher ranges for Greece
* added test file for valid_isbn_checksum function

* added a valid_isbn_checksum exportable routine to just return the
answer without the object stuff at the user level.

* Fix Exporter import. It seems there are still some people using MacOS 9.
They have ancient perls with ancient Exporters.

* fix RT # 28843: _parse_prefix in ISBN13.pm accepted anything that was 13
characters and started with three digits, causing _set_prefix to croak when
it tried to set an invalid prefix. I updated _parse_prefix to be stricter.
* add rt/27107.t to the distro and tests
* let's promote this to a full fledged release
*Added 7000-8499 range from Greece (960) to fix RT #27107
Add author to Makefile.PL and tag version as dev release
Consolidating the documentation and filling out the tests. Almost there :)

* test for exportable constants
* list of bad ISBNs to check

* rewrote most of the code and moved the common parts into ISBN.pm
for ISBN10.pm.

* Got the ISBN10 stuff to work with a prefix of the empty string. This
allows me to treat it the same as ISBN13.
Start of refactoring to support ISBN13
* cleanups for the distro and kwalitee

* Fixed a small problem in the validating code. It turns out that 0
is a valid publisher code (why god? why?) so when I check the publisher
code I need to check for definedness, not value.

* I added albania.t since it was an Albanian ISBN that did it.

* expose the "country" group name as the country method. It should
have been done earlier but I overlooked it.
* The data file is now in a separate distribution

* add pod_coverage.t to MANIFEST!  Oops!

* use the latest Test::Manifest, and get rid of the ExtUtils::*
hackery in Makefile.PL.  All the magic happens through MY::* in
Test::Manifest
* added POD Coverage tests and fixed up the problems it found
* added POD coverage test and fixed up the uncovered functions
* added a POD coverage test, and added docs for the uncovered methods

* Updated tests reflect the latest changes to the ISBN prefixes and
publisher codes (ISBNs that were invalid before are valid now).

* This distro requires Business::ISBN::Data 1.09, which has all of
the new data.  The failures with 1.08 are from old data.

* Beyond that, there are no code or feature changes.  If you already
have this module, you can get by with the new data pack:
Business::ISBN::Data 1.09

* I updated the prefixes and publisher ranges for the latest data
from the ISBN folks: http://www.isbn-international.org/en/manual.html

* I added a kludegy script, make_data.pl, that takes the prefix
ranges in the PDF file and converts it to a Perl data structure.
It's quick and dirty, but I commented most of it. Updates are
infrequent, so I didn't spend too much time with the script.
The script documents what I did to update the data.

* Everyone should update to the latest version.

* require the latest version of Business::ISBN::Data,
which you need to pass the tests

* removed Business::ISBN::Data from the distribution.  It's a separate
module now, so CPAN.pm installs it first, and the version in this
dist overwrote it with old data.  Bad, bad, bad!

* added note about 13 digit ISBNs
* no feature changes
* added use strict, since kwalitee now tracks it

* added SourceForge address to SOURCE note
* updated email address

* got rid of most prerequisites
* use Test::Manifest if it is around
* refactor the file name into a variable so I only sayit once
* small distribution fixes, no big whoop
* created with make maifest, so now they are in order

* added note about LightningSource's ISBN bar code generator
* added note about Ed Summers helping out
* cleaned-up email addresses to use C<< >>
* do not put these files in the MANIFEST
* Makemaker will automatically create META.yml for us

* this is only a distribution fix, not a bug fix

* use of Test::Manifest is optional

* the xisbn test turns off spurious Test::More warnings

* removed the comment about the source of data, which I now generate
myself from ISBN.org

* cheack for required modules in png_barcode, and warn if they aren't there
* previous behaviour is a fatal error

* removed the no warnings statement since the warnings
are from Test::More

* i'm getting uninitialized value warnings, so i'll turn off warnings
until i can figure it out.  it is just temporary
* added support for OCLC's xIBSN project

* removed File::Find::Rule and some test dependencies

* use TEst::Manifest

* made some lines a bit more pretty

* made isbns.txt filename a variable so i only have to specify it once

* hard code class names to get rid of File::Find::Rule

* bail out if nothing compiles

* combined the former Yugoslavian states into one group.
Their keys were overwriting each other before

* fixed Makefile.PL to install in right place.  it had
an extra ISBN in the path because I added ::Data to the NAME
do not put these files in MANIFEST

* use Test::Manifest
* put man pages in the right place
* generated from make manifest - no tests prereqs
* changed to use base for Exporter
* bail out if a class can't compile

* fixed checksum routine.  the old test data ended in zero,
so when i kept getting zero, it didn't realize something was
wrong.  when i added more ISMNs, it figured it out.
* thsi list of files goes into the distro
* POD fixes - use items rather than head2s

* added new EAN prefix 979 support
* fixed some pod bummers
* changed _common_format so that it untaints the data

* removed a couple of lines that tried to short-circuit checking
all publisher codes.  in Data.pm, the publisher code ranges are
listed in roughly the ASCII-betical order, but i was looking at
their lengths.

this bug presented itself while checking for German ISBNs and
identified by  Christian Kirsch <ck@held.mind.de>.  since the
range 200-699 sorts after 0340-0369, it couldn't check publisher
codes correctly.

this was further exacerbated by an oversight in test.pl, which
only checked the numbers in isbns.txt for valid checksums, not
valid ISBNs.  that is now fixed too.

* removed hyphens

* removed two bad ISBNs -- 99900 is not a valid country code
* more German ISBNs from  Christian Kirsch <ck@held.mind.de>.
* added stuff to upload barcode image to website
* added an example barcode image generated by the module
* added a mehtod to produce an EAN13 barcode, in PNG format, from the ISBN

* only performs the isbn file test if isbns.txt is readable.  otherwise
it skips this test.  now i don't have to distribute the huge isbns.txt
file. :)

* removed the isbns.txt file to make the distribution smaller.  i'll
leave it in the CVS source, and i'll still be able to complete that
test, but other users shouldn't need it.
* a script to pull down ISBN data and partially munge it.

* added Sourceforge links so users can go directly to the parts of the
project they most likely want to use.
fixed misquoted link to sourceforge file section

Fixed a quoting problem with group code 986 - China wasn't quoted
so any attempts to look that up should fail big time.
* removed data from this module (it's now in Data.pm)
* removed a bunch of bad and malformed ISBNs

* added a test to check a long list of ISBNs

* fixed the BAD_COUNTRY_CODE since now Brunei is 99901
* a list of ISBNs from Andy Lester that we can use for testing

* there were ^M line endings.  the file was uploaded via maccvs
and created in BBEdit, so i gotta look into that.

* This is the new data from www.isbn.org.  There are some minor differences
from the previous data.  Some changes look like keying errors while others
appear to be added data since I got the original data.

* This is the first stab at separating the ISBN data from
the code so that the data (or the code) can be updated
separately.  eventually this should allow users to specify
a data source, including things that are not necessarily
text files.  volunteers? ;)
Added missing commas to revised data format
Sorted all the country data down at the bottom to make it easier to pick through it all

* syncing this version number with the one from my local CVS repository.
this is the version number that is now on CPAN.
* this file was from something else, which has claimed it.

* these files were from some other universe.  they have since returned
there.

issue.title: isbn group tests fail with new ::Data
issue.body:
The latest GA level of Business::ISBN on the CPAN is 2.05, while Business::ISBN::Data appears to be at a later level.  When the newer ::Data is used to satisfy Business::ISBN's dependency, we see failures:

```
PERL_DL_NONLAZY=1 /export/home/cpan/pit/64bit/perl-5.16.1/bin/perl "-MExtUtils::Command::MM" "-e" "test_harness(0, 'blib/lib', 'blib/arch')" t/*.t
t/albania.t .............. ok
defined(%hash) is deprecated at t/constants.t line 9.
    (Maybe you should just omit the defined()?)
t/constants.t ............ ok
t/interface.t ............ ok

#   Failed test 'Bad group code [9997022576] is invalid'
#   at t/isbn10.t line 101.
#          got: '-1'
#     expected: '-2'
# 
# Checking ISBNs... (this may take a bit)
# 
# Checking bad ISBNs... (this should be fast)
# Looks like you failed 1 test of 39.
t/isbn10.t ............... 
Dubious, test returned 1 (wstat 256, 0x100)
Failed 1/39 subtests 

#   Failed test 'Bad group code [978-9997022576] is invalid'
#   at t/isbn13.t line 130.
#          got: '-1'
#     expected: '-2'
# 
# Checking ISBN13s... (this may take a bit)
# 
# Checking bad ISBN13s... (this should be fast)
# Looks like you failed 1 test of 41.
t/isbn13.t ............... 
```

...that is, it's failing on checksum not group code checks.

I've not been able to reproduce this test with 2.05_03 of Business::ISBN.  Is that level ready for prime time?  (cpan, that is?)

Thanks :)

issue.title: Update in Business::ISBN::Data
issue.body: I updated make_data.pl and its output in Data.pm because the international ISBN agency has changed their database format. I also updated the documentation but not the file 'Changes'. Meanwhile there are also ISBN 979- ranges, so the ISBN-10 agency prefix may not be unique unless you know you have an ISBN-10. Some Agency names have also changes (it is "English language" instead of "English"), so some tests will likely break. I have not fixed this because the connection between Business::ISBN::Data and Business::ISBN to me looks like an ugly hack anyway - I wonder why Business::ISBN::Data puts thinks into the Business::ISBN namespace? Maybe you can have a look and decide whether and how to clean up Business::ISBN.

up in the right place now
minor adjustments for first testing pass

let's move on to testing it.

First pass at modularizing my module cookier script. The goal
right now is to make it do what my old script did. I'll add
things later.

issue.title: Document an issue with Windows
issue.body:
I have run into the following issue in Windows. I think it should be documented:

When using IO::Interactive in the Windows environment, then `is_interactive` will always return true when the program is run as a Scheduled Task, even when it is run as the "SYSTEM" user.

commit.message: Remove bad link so testing doesn't take too long
Add v5.22 to Travis, and run in container by turning off sudo
Add v5.22 to Travis, and run in container by turning off sudo
Fix whitespace in YAML: tabs no longer allowed
Add Pod to all the Makefile.PLs
The new README.pod, fit for GitHub
It's not bugtraker with no c
Update LICENSE file to include full license
Most of the modernization of Makefile.PL
Die if we cannot load correct ExtUtils::MakeMaker
Fix changes.t for missing interpolated variable
Add author test for Changes file
normalize Changes header line according to CPAN::Changes::Spec
Remove v1 stuff. It is in the repo still :)

Move modules to conventional location, remove CVS tags

Also add pod encoding and update copyright dates

* updated Makefile.PL for latest practice

* removed unused Exporter bits from modules

* Netscape::Bookmarks called Netscape::Bookmarks::Category::new()
by passing pairs instead of a hash reference. I fixed that, added
tests, and an added an assertion to  Netscape::Bookmarks::Category::new()
in case it happens again. :)

* fix Pod errors in Visitor.pm

* Added README
* adjusting distro to fix broken Pod::Coverage

* Reference argument fixes from Ben Markins

* Added LICENSE stuff

* Add a nother branch in _as_string to warn about objects the
method can't handle.

* fixed a dereferencing bug that keep _as_string from descending into the
data structure. I ended up passing around an ARRAY instead of one of
the object types _as_string() thought it could work with. It just failed
silently.

* squashed some warnings

* Bookmarks.pm now defines a default title for an empty object.

* Updated MANIFEST, MANIFEST.SKIP to ignore Mac files starting in ._
I don't think it's working. Those files are invisible at the wrong
time, then visible at the next wrong time.

* took care of a warning in *::Category->new().

* took care of a warning in *::Link

* The Netscape::Bookmarks::Category::add() function did too much
de-referencing

* I updated the docs to get rid of the indirect object notation
* newline added at end of file

* ignore temp HTML file from tests
* removed that temp file
* noted that Netscape also means Mozilla

* get rid of uninit variable warnings by setting some values
to the empty string if they don't have a true value.

* set the $flag to the empty string to get rid of uninit
variable warnings.  This isn't the greatest thing to do, but
$flag will never be a literal false value (0, for instance), so
it's okay.

* get rid of uninit variable warning by
giving $desc an empty string if it is undefined (because
it's an optional part of the description

* new location: everything in lib/ now
* updated email addresses in POD
* added sourceforge notes

* test.pl moved to t/bookmarks.t
* Bookmarks.pm moved into lib

* these files used to be in separate module directories as
their own test.pl.  I've gotten rid of the individual module
directories and shoved all the tests in here.

* i added the standard distribution files too.

* use Test::Manifest if it is around
* get rid of a bunch of dependencies (ensure they are gone, too\!)

* use sprintf to make $VERSION
* use base() instead of \@ISA
* Mixin Netscape::Bookmarks::Isa (why?)
* test introduce().  This needs more tests
* a couple of simple tests, but hardly adequate
* why did I make this again?
* documentation fix - wrong module name in SYNOPSIS

* added support for Mozilla bookmark files
	+ has an extra meta tag
	+ indents a bit differently
	+ additional attributes in categories and links

* some stuff is now pretty unwieldly and could use a good round of
refactoring.

- converted tests to Test::Builder
	- fixed many POD bummers
    - check a few values for definedness before using
    them ( thanks to Shayne )
    - start adding Mozilla support
* start converting to modern testing system
* made the Separator object a Singleton
* changed to Unix newlines - damn BBEdit
* removed a temporary file that should not be listed
* this file should have never been here
* a Visitor base class.  all it does is the double dispatch right now
* fixed missing characters from VERSION statement

* Category and link descriptions (from the <DD> tags) were being mixed
up, and the wrong things were printing. Mark Stosberg was kind enough
to debug this for me.

* added a bit of debugging output that can be emitted in the undocumented
environment variable NS_DEBUG has a true value.

* test.pl doesn't delete the output file so you can inspect it.
* updated docs to point towards SourceForge project.

* fixed numerous documentation problems

* added a function to return the 'description' attribute.
added SourceForge links and personal web page link
hopefully this will automagically publish the web stuff
first stab at a web page

* added new location of Bookmarks.html to MANIFEST, and
removed old location.  this should be why the tests on
CPAN failed although i thought they passed here.  i need
to do better testing, obviously.

updated address.
* this update is mostly to get something onto CPAN.  for
some reason the 1.3 file is missing, and CPAN will not let
me upload a duplicate version.  i need to upload a new
version, so here it is.

* moved Bookmarks.html to the bookmark_files subdirectory

* added bookmarks files for
	+ IE 4.5 (Mac)
	+ Netscape 4.72 (FreeBSD)
	+ iCab 2.5.3 (PPC)

* moved Bookmarks.html to the bookmark_files subdirectory, which now contains
bookmark files from other browsers.

* modified test.pl to find Bookmarks.html and to create its temp file in
